title: NCAA Ruling Heralds A New, And Murky, Era
teaser: A U.S. district court judge ruled that the NCAA was violating federal anti-trust law by prohibiting payments to athletes whose names, images and likenesses are used in video games and TV broadcasts. The NCAA has appealed. So, what now?
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
